paragraphs: Yetnebersh Nigussie didn’t realise she was different until she was 12. Only when she started at a mainstream school and found that no one wanted to be her friend did she start to understand that being a blind girl in rural Ethiopia might bring with it a few challenges.
With this award comes international recognition," she says. "Women with disabilities in Ethiopia face multiple layers of discrimination.
